value.title: Count of Unique Values DistinctCount in Power BI Through Power Query Group By Transformation
value.excerpt: You can have a distinct count calculation in multiple places in Power BI, through DAX code, using the Visual's aggregation on a field, or even in Power Query. If you are doing the distinct count in Power Query as part of a group by operation, however, the existing distinct count is for all columns in

value.title: Export the Data of a Power BI table entirely in a few Clicks
value.excerpt: If you want to export the data of a Power BI table, you have options such as copy and paste, or putting it in a visual and export it. However, there is an easier way available too. You can use Power BI Helper (free tool) to export the entire data of the table. The instruction below explains how it is

value.title: Getting Started with Dataflow in Microsoft Fabric Data Factory
value.excerpt: The Dataflow in Microsoft Fabric is an element for getting the data from the source, transforming it, and loading it into a destination. In this article and video, we will go through what Dataflow is and how it works with a simple example of it. Learn more from my article here: https://radacad.com/getting-started-with-dataflow-in-microsoft-fabric-data-factory
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ub9mpvk6xuU" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to Do Power BI Mapping With Latitude and Longitude Only
value.excerpt: You can just use latitude and longitude to visualize data on the map. In this video, you will learn how you can do that with the map visual in Power BI. Read more and download the dataset from my blog article link here: https://radacad.com/how-to-do-power-bi-mapping-with-latitude-and-longitude-only

value.title: Power BI Datamart vs Dataflow vs Dataset
value.excerpt: Datamart, Dataflow, and Dataset are all Power BI components dealing with the data. I have presented about these a lot, and one of the questions I get is: What is the difference between Dataflow, Dataset, and Datamart? So I thought to explain it in a video and help everyone in that understanding. In this
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Biz-s-YoKRc" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI Get Data from Google Sheets
value.excerpt: Power BI can get data from Google Sheet now. This functionality is released just yesterday and announced in both Power BI and Power Query blogs. The feature is still preview (Beta) but it is worthwhile looking at how it works in a quick article and video. Study more from my blog article here:  https://radacad.com/power-bi-get-data-from-google-sheets

value.title: What is Microsoft Fabric Data Warehouse
value.excerpt: Microsoft Fabric, an end-to-end Saas cloud-based analytics platform, has many workloads and objects. One of the Objects is called Data Warehouse, or in short, Warehouse. In this article, I'll explain what the Data Warehouse in Microsoft Fabric is and how it works, and I will show you an example of it

value.title: What is Power BI Dataflow and Why you should use it
value.excerpt: Dataflows are an important component in the Power BI architecture. Using them can enhance the development and maintenance of your Power BI solution significantly. However, there are many Power BI implementations that are not using this functionality, even though it is already more than three years passed

value.title: Why Power BI totals might seem wrong
value.excerpt: A common question is why Power BI totals are inaccurate because they do not display the sum of individual rows. In this video, we explain the reasons why those totals are correct. Article and download: https://sql.bi/772093?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive

value.title: Govern data across an enterprise
value.excerpt: Govern data across an enterprise

topItems.title: Discover trusted data using Microsoft Purview
Manage Power BI assets by using Microsoft Purview
topItems.excerpt: Improve data governance and asset discovery using Power BI and Microsoft Purview integration.

value.title: Introduction to data analytics on Azure
value.excerpt: Introduction to data analytics on Azure

topItems.title: Explore Azure data services for modern analytics
topItems.excerpt: Understand analytics solutions in the Azure data ecosystem. Explore the architecture of a scalable analytics solution to meet business needs.

topItems.title: Understand concepts of data analytics
topItems.excerpt: Explore key concepts of data analytics, including types of analytics, data, and storage. Explore the analytics process and tools used to discover insights.

topItems.title: Explore data analytics at scale
topItems.excerpt: Describe data analytics at scale and understand the roles of a data team. Learn about the responsibilities of an enterprise data analyst and what tools are available to build scalable solutions.

value.title: Use DAX time intelligence functions in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you'll learn the meaning of time intelligence and how to add time intelligence DAX calculations to your model. These calculations will include year-to-date (YTD), year-over-year (YoY) growth, and others.

value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

value.title: Discover trusted data using Microsoft Purview
value.excerpt: purview, enterprise data analyst
